elements.title: Mussel Inn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the proprietor of the music venue the Mussel Inn (pictured) in Onekaka built tables strong enough for up to eight people to dance on?

elements.title: Fabrizio Dori (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fabrizio Dori wants his comic book Il dio vagabondo to bring attention to an ancient Greek view of death?

elements.title: Paul Nunn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Paul Nunn worked as a climbing double for Sean Connery on the film Five Days One Summer?

elements.title: PHerc. Paris. 4 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that it took a particle accelerator and machine-learning algorithms to extract the charred text of PHerc. Paris. 4 without unrolling it?

elements.title: Cecelia Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American mezzo-soprano Cecelia Hall portrayed the lead male role in Mozart's Ascanio in Alba?

elements.title: Matt Rempe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New York Rangers forward Matt Rempe is the first ice hockey player to make his National Hockey League debut in an outdoor game?

elements.title: Weise's law (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Weise's law was first proposed as a way to explain why cognates differ unexpectedly in ancient Greek and Sanskrit?

elements.title: William Kuykendall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Oregon state senator William Kuykendall was a physician who founded the first hospital in Eugene, Oregon?

elements.title: Grounded (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Grounded, an opera about drone warfare, was sponsored by General Dynamics, a major military contractor?
